column4: i switched to xgl and it messed up my graphics, how do i revert to whatever i had before?
sudo apt-get remove xserver-xgl shouold help you
i did that last night, it says its not installed, a smarter friend said he thinks im using the wrong drivers now
it says its not installed anymore, i think it took it out last night
do i want to use framebuffer device interface?
it might not hurt to enable it
what kind of graphics card are you using?
you have to use the xorg drivers the ati binaries suck they don't support the 9000igp I have that card in my laptop
that sounds like what my buddy said last night
optyx: what can i do to make it work? i was running compiz with all sorts of things working great
optyx: should i close the xserver configuration program?
Foso: no finish it and use the fbdev driver
optyx: do i want the framebuffer thing?
Its mainly a fluke when you get compiz to work on the 9000igp
